H0.text: Mutualism is the relationship between ticks and a dog.

H1.text: Competition is the best description of the relationship between ticks and a dog.

H2.text: Parasitism is the relationship between ticks and a dog.

H3.text: Commensalism is the relationship between ticks and a dog.

A4.text: Ticks are external parasites, living by feeding on the blood of mammals, birds, and sometimes reptiles and amphibians.

A5.text: Ticks can transmit an array of infectious diseases that affect humans and other animals.
